programme.title: Hellbound: Hellraiser II (1988)

programme.title: Air America (1990)
programme.desc: A reckless traffic reporter for a radio station loses his helicopter pilot's licence, but is recruited by the CIA into a secret organisation transporting cargo and troops around Southeast Asia during the Vietnam War. However, he not only discovers his superiors are involved in smuggling drugs, but his co-pilot also has an illicit sideline of his own. Comedy adventure, with Mel Gibson, Robert Downey Jr, Nancy Travis, Burt Kwouk and Ken Jenkins

programme.title: Office Uprising (2018)
programme.desc: A young man discovers that his co-workers at a weapons manufacturing unit have turned into violent psychopaths after sampling a new energy drink created for the military. Comedy horror, starring Brenton Thwaites and Jane Levy

programme.title: Gothika (2003)
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husband's murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Evil Dead II (1987)
programme.desc: Hapless Ash takes his girlfriend to a remote cabin in the woods, only for her to be killed and possessed by evil spirits. As a motley group of strangers turns up, they too find themselves under attack from demonic entities, leaving Ash the task of fending off the forces of darkness with his trusty chainsaw. Sam Raimi's comic horror sequel, starring Bruce Campbell and Sarah Berry

programme.title: The 39 Steps (2008)
programme.desc: Rupert Penry-Jones stars in this adaptation of John Buchan's classic novel, set in 1914. Engineer Richard Hannay is bored and restless in London - until he meets Scudder, who claims to be a British spy. When the agent is killed in his flat, Hannay is thrown headlong into adventure, forced to go on the run under suspicion of murder. Fleeing to Scotland, with police and spies on his tail, he teams up with feisty suffragette Victoria Sinclair, and although they fail to hit it off, the couple become increasingly reliant on each other as they race to unmask a traitor and save Great Britain from German invasion. Action thriller, co-starring Eddie Marsan and Lydia Leonard

programme.desc: David and Andrew strive to convince the authorities that mass inoculation is the only way to prevent a meningitis outbreak sweeping through Cardale - but unfortunately, their advice falls on deaf ears. Adrian Lukis and Gary Mavers star

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec fixes up a lunch meeting to discuss Zoe's divorce. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey's old school friend wishes to visit, but is unaware of her former classmate's unfortunate circumstances, so the former lady of the manor arranges for DeVere to entertain her. Classic comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles. First shown in 1980

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora gets her hands on Compo, with surprisingly therapeutic results, inspiring Truly and Clegg to lead him off the straight and narrow. Classic comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis, Kathy Staff and Frank Thornton

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly decides to put his extensive police training to good use by roping Compo and Clegg into his newly formed active rescue team, and finds there is only one thing stopping them becoming heroes - the lack of a casualty. Long-running comedy, starring Frank Thornton

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Roman Catholic priest spies trouble when Lady Felicia returns to Kembleford from Africa, having split from her lover Benedict Northam. Mark Williams stars

programme.title: Smother
programme.desc: Carl comes under fire as events from his past life in Denmark come to light, and Val looks to Mairead for support as she struggles to come to terms with the personal and professional implications of this news. Jenny's colleague confides in her about his concerns regarding possible financial impropriety at their practice, and Calum has a run-in with a group of local lads. Thriller, starring Dervla Kirwan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the killing of notorious biker-gang leader Eddie Chapman when his son's girlfriend brings them new information about his death. She reveals her partner must avenge his father's murder as part of a final initiation into the gang, but believes the wrong man is being targeted. Meanwhile, Sandra is forced to reassess her position at Ucos when a former colleague suggests she is wasting her career. Starring Amanda Redman, with her real-life daughter Emily Glenister in a supporting role

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Jessica and Mark go on a romantic break to make up after a drunken argument, while Trudi starts to question her future with Richard after discovering the reality of his estranged wife's situation. Katie and Jack spend time together, but things turn sour when he and his wife turn up at Dan's for lunch. Siobhan encourages Hari to open a restaurant so she can quit her job - which she thinks is the perfect way to get their marriage back on track

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved murder of pornographer Jim Hockney is reopened when his daughter Sara provides DNA proof he wasn't her father. The team tries to track down jazz singer Angela Gold, who was the victim's girlfriend at the time and disappeared from the music scene after being acquitted of the crime, and it's Brian's replacement Danny Griffin (Nicholas Lyndhurst) who manages to find her. However, with Angela professing her innocence and Sara's mother Jane also arousing suspicion, it becomes a struggle to determine who is telling the truth. With a guest appearance by former Corrie killer Brian Capron

programme.title: Lovejoy

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac and Kian return to work and support each other as they try to conquer their demons, and Sacha's feelings for Essie are only being made worse by living together. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford checks in to the B&B, so Sharon and the team put her to work helping to run the establishment. The broadcaster soon gets stuck in with the day-to-day tasks

Anthony McGill v Si Jiahui and John Higgins v Mark Selby. Four-time champion Higgins prevailed by the narrowest of margins at this stage last year, winning 13-12 against Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale and his team travel to Skye to transform a dated cafe and bookshop, and the interior designer takes the bold decision to spend almost all his budget on a set of huge stained-glass windows. Far from home and with tricky logistics, will this job push the team to the limit and will Banjo's ambitious gamble pay off with his clients?

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues in north-west Wales with visits to a dainty barn conversion outside Caernarfon, an imposing Victorian residence in Llandudno and an extended seaside lodge just outside Conwy. The judges are led by presenter Owain Wyn Evans, with interior designer Mandy Watkins and architect Glen Thomas, who score the properties out of 10 on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself interviews the contenders about their performance

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Leeds General Infirmary plastic surgeon Chris West's patients today include 67-year-old Trevor, who needs surgery to remove small bits of tumour left behind from a previous operation. But Trevor suffers from anxiety and the stress of waiting is making his condition worse, so before long he tries to leave. Meanwhile, neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on a tumour growing deep behind a patient's ear, which if not removed could paralyse her face

Alex Jones also meets ex-soldier Nathan, who was sent to Belfast for his first operational tour at 18. His behaviour took a downward spiral, including what he recalls as causing trouble for his commanding officer, so he seeks forgiveness from his former platoon officer

However, after their money worries take an unexpected turn, they find themselves deported back to Edinburgh where enemies old and new cause them to seek ever more desperate solutions to their problems. programme.desc: Action from day 13 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as both semi-finals got under way

programme.title: Little Richard: King and Queen of Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: The life and career of the pioneering musician, a black artist who grew up in the segregated American South and broke down barriers and took 1950s America by storm. The Beatles and the Rolling Stones supported him and took inspiration from his musicianship and stagecraft, and he went on to influence artists as diverse as David Bowie, Elton John, Michael Jackson and Prince. Featuring interviews with Ringo Starr, Keith Richards, Nile Rodgers and Big Freedia, alongside intimate contributions from friends, bandmates and Little Richard himself, this feature-length documentary tells the story of a rollercoaster life

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: After spending the early 2000s perched on the high horse of respectability politics, Bill Cosby falls from grace with two trials, a conviction, incarceration, appeal - and in 2021 - an overturned verdict. W Kamau Bell asks what this means for people's attitudes to his previous work and the larger systemic problems Cosby's story lays bare

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The dark side of the all-male stripping troupe, a global phenomenon in the 1980s that was masterminded by an Indian entrepreneur and a children's TV producer. In the first edition, showbusiness beckons when Steve Banerjee leaves India for the bright lights of Los Angeles, purchasing a night club and going into partnership with Nick de Noia

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: How the rise of the dance troupe brought a growing mountain of problems, including the attention of mobsters, disgruntled dancers and churchgoers. Nick De Noia and Steve Banerjee, the two masterminds behind the show, quickly grew obsessed with their fortunes - until a shocking murder which left NYPD detectives at a loss

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The first quarter-final sees this week's most talented four cooks return to contest a place in the semi-finals. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by last year's series finalists and champion, namely Eddie Scott, Pookie Tredell and Radha Kaushal-Bolland. Only the best cooks can earn themselves a place in knockout week, so these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the 2023 trophy

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The team investigates long covid and the criminals cashing in on it with the help of consultant Joanna Herman who suffers from it herself. Plus, an exploration into the dangerous side effects of some common acne medications. Dr Xand examines the latest social media trend in which people tape their mouths closed while asleep to help with breathing, snoring and bad breath

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gets to work on his veg plot and plants his first lot of potatoes. Joe Swift meets a garden designer who faced the challenge of two awkward, adjoining plots and transformed them into wonderful, cohesive spaces. Plus, Rekha Mistry demonstrates how to grow the perfect onion from seed, and has a go at growing cotton

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams and Judd Trump won four frames apiece in last year's corresponding session, but the dominance of 'The Juddernaut' in the morning meant he went held a comfortable-looking 11-5 lead

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield featuring session two of the second semi-final. Ronnie O'Sullivan moved into a 10-6 lead over John Higgins at this stage last year, fighting back from 51 points behind with 51 remaining in the final frame of the session to put himself into a strong position going into Saturday's play

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge skills and keep their eyes on the prize before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Ellie Simmonds won the nation's hearts competing for Team GB during four Paralympic games. She might have recently retired from swimming, but still has a special connection to the water. After she checks into the 19th-century Victorian villa, Sharon and the team take her on a whistle-stop tour of Northern Ireland's Causeway coast. During her stay, she sets sail on the Atlantic Ocean, discovering all the coastline has to offer, including the site of former Kinbane Castle. Ellie also visits a potato farm with a spectacular view and gets down and dirty digging for some spuds

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams enjoyed his strongest session of his match against Judd Trump at this stage last year, winning six of eight frames to reduce his opponent's lead to 13-11 and receiving a standing ovation. However, it was ultimately 'the Juddernaut' who progressed to the final

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena reaches the end of her historical journey, and finds herself in Brexit Britain. Comedy documentary, starring Diane Morgan, with guests Howard Goodall, Mark Lawson, Neil Oliver and Robert Peston

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood travels across the US to discover the stories behind his artistic heroes from the 1960s to the 1990s. Along the way he discovers how these African-American performers, film-makers and writers have come to transform popular culture around the world

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the largest island of the Indonesian archipelago, travelling through rainforests and paddy fields from the capital, Jakarta, to the volcanic region at the heart of Java's Central Province. He visits Java's most dangerous volcano, Mount Merapi, learns how to make noodles, and visits the Borobudur Temple, a Buddhist shrine that lay buried under a layer of volcanic ash for centuries

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship

programme.title: Davis v Taylor: The '85 Black Ball Final
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a look back at the final of the 1985 World Snooker Championship between Dennis Taylor and Steve Davis. The match finished after midnight, but kept an estimated 18.5 million viewers engrossed until the title was decided on the final black of the 35th frame. With contributions from Barry McGuigan, Ted Lowe, Stephen Hendry and Barry Hearn

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Michael is infatuated with Nell and begins to defy his father's dominance. Luke's star is rising, Sheila has met her match and Maggie heads for married life

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Sheila's wedding offers a last chance for Luke and Moran to be reconciled. For Moran's daughters, however, his decline reminds them they were never able to leave him. In a bid to help, they organise a family reunion. Drama, starring Tony Doyle, Ger Ryan, Susan Lynch and Anne-Marie Duff

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: The day of the festival arrives, and the showman's wagon is revealed to the locals. Plus, Griff Rhys Jones reflects on George's first job as an architectural designer as work on the cottage and the mill is finally completed

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the largest island of the Indonesian archipelago, travelling through rainforests and paddy fields from the capital, Jakarta, to the volcanic region at the heart of Java's Central Province. He visits Java's most dangerous volcano, Mount Merapi, learns how to make noodles, and visits the Borobudur Temple, a Buddhist shrine that lay buried under a layer of volcanic ash for centuries

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln

programme.title: Davis v Taylor: The '85 Black Ball Final
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a look back at the final of the 1985 World Snooker Championship between Dennis Taylor and Steve Davis. The match finished after midnight, but kept an estimated 18.5 million viewers engrossed until the title was decided on the final black of the 35th frame. With contributions from Barry McGuigan, Ted Lowe, Stephen Hendry and Barry Hearn

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 13 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the opening session of the second semi-final. There was nothing between John Higgins and Ronnie O'Sullivan at the end of last year's corresponding session, as they went into Friday's play level at 4-4, but it was O'Sullivan who would eventually prevail and go on to win the title for the seventh time in his illustrious career

programme.title: Stan & Ollie (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of Laurel and Hardy, focusing on the events of 1953 as the comedy duo try to re-ignite their film careers by embarking on a gruelling tour of British variety halls. As they set out on their demanding schedule, with their wives back home in the US, Stan is distracted by his attempts to pin down the producer of their proposed comeback film and Ollie tries to heal a rift caused by a perceived professional betrayal. The build-up of pressure starts to tarnish their precious partnership. Steve Coogan and John C Reilly star

programme.title: The Belles of St Trinian's (1954)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls hope to get rich quick by betting on a racehorse belonging to a classmate's wealthy father. However, they first have to foil a gang of thieves planning to steal the animal and outwit an undercover policewoman sent to infiltrate the school disguised as a teacher. Comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Joyce Grenfell and George Cole

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Timeshift

Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways

programme.title: Zappa (2020)
programme.desc: The first all-access documentary - years in the making - about Frank Zappa. It conveys the scope of his prodigious and varied creative output, and the breadth of his extraordinary personal and political life. The documentary team was granted exclusive access by Gail Zappa to a vast collection of Zappa's unreleased music, movies, incomplete projects, unseen interviews and unheard concert recordings. Much of these were deteriorating and in danger of being lost for ever

programme.desc: Mr Malone holds a mock trial to resolve a dispute Martha and Ollie are having over the ownership of Edison, a cuddly lightbulb they won together at a fairground hoopla. Lily is Martha’s disappointing lawyer - whilst promising an epic opening statement, Lily makes it all about Rob being in America. Ollie asks Martha to prove she can throw a hoop on target. Martha objects, but Judge Kat insists that it will be amusing to witness Martha throw hoops. Martha applies the scientific calculations she gave to Ollie to help him win Edison, but she still fails to throw a hoop successfully. Ollie nears victory when the court adjourns because Mr Malone is hungry. Later, whilst Rufus admits to Kat that he doesn’t feel he is cut out to be a lawyer, he offers Kat the largest slice of cake even though he wants it. This infuriates Kat. programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Coding Genius follows 11-tear-old Emmanuella, who has a passion for coding. She hit the headlines in the UK after setting up lessons for school kids like her and is determined to go further. Now based in the Nigerian capital Abuja, Emmanuella has work to do - she wants to pass on her love of coding to other girls in the city and launches CodeKid, an after-school, weekend and holiday club for girls aged 6 - 15. But will they turn up, or will the thought of coding keep them away? In this short film, we find out what started Emmanuella's love of coding, and get to know her extraordinary ambitions for changing the world, one coding club at a time.

programme.desc: It’s the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: MD Ian's stress levels are up. He's ordered 40 brand new greener trucks that can run on hydrogenated vegetable oil. The new hi-tech vehicles are fitted with cameras in place of mirrors to increase visibility - but company stalwart and long-time driver The Donk is not convinced. It's naming day for bin man Jason's new litter, while trucker Tigger battles her way through the medieval streets of York

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Celebrated tenor and Radio Wales presenter Wynne Evans explores the BBC Wales archives of the 1970s to share some nostalgia and reveal some film memories of his own. Turning his attention to 1971, his highlights include music from Harry Secombe, The Tom Jones Show and a visit to Max Boyce's old stomping ground. Plus, a female Private Eyes swops her trench-coat for a beauty contest bikini, there's a Christmas baby competition in Neath and Earth Kitt reveals the heartache of being abandoned as a baby

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2019 champion Irini Tzortzoglou, 2021 champion Tom Rhodes and 2018 semi-finalist Nisha Parmar

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts as journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Phil Wang join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: A gamekeeper is murdered in rural Wales, and it falls to Wicky to clean up the mess. However, Wicky and the undertakers aren't the only people at the scene of the crime - and things soon take an even more sinister turn. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Joshua McCord and Zita Sattar

programme.title: The Martian (2015)
programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. However, the astronaut has survived and faces a series of challenges - to contact Earth and arrange his rescue and to survive for the years it will take for a spacecraft to reach him on resources intended to last the crew a month. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.desc: Presented by Laura Miller

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Chelsea steps in to support the Brannings. Keanu talks to Zack about Ravi's dodgy dealings, but he warns him that he should not get involved. However, Ravi agrees to give him a trial run by taking in a suspicious delivery the next day

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: David Farrell chats to the new stars of BBC hit Guilt, as well as rapper Bemz, and there is report from the red carpet premiere of Richard Madden's big-budget thriller Citadel

programme.title: Debate Night
programme.desc: Topical debate on the big issues affecting Scotland and beyond. Members of the public have an hour to put their questions to a panel of politicians and other public figures about the biggest stories and the things they care about the most

programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple find a new home in Somerset where they can create their very own back garden vegetable patch. Away from the search, Sonia also learns about the potentially perilous Bristol Channel and meets the volunteers who operate two life-saving rescue hovercrafts

programme.desc: This week's seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to test their culinary wits. Challenges include cooking a dish to a brief set by one of the country's toughest food critics, Leyla Kazim. John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be passing judgement as usual

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.desc: Alexander Van Tulleken considers the deadly effects of diet pills and whether breakfast truly is the most important meal. Plus, the myth that local honey helps hayfever is busted

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Paramedics attending to a man found slumped in Edinburgh city centre suspect an overdose of 'street Valium'. They also treat a frail pensioner with a suspected broken hip

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Raj Bisram and Catherine Southon help teams at Sandown Park Racecourse in Surrey find items of value. Before heading off to the auction, presenter Eric Knowles pays a visit to the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, where they use the exhibits to offer reminiscence therapy to people with memory problems

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Imogen talks to Sid about Rob, Ollie and Scarlett continue to flirt, and Bear shows Tanisha the mill. Al is shocked to meet a patient who is live-streaming his life

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team has just one day to help Jan, who works seven days a week, transform her bedroom into a relaxing sanctuary and give her space to rediscover her love of fashion

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple find a new home in Somerset where they can create their very own back garden vegetable patch. Away from the search, Sonia also learns about the potentially perilous Bristol Channel and meets the volunteers who operate two life-saving rescue hovercrafts

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers and expert auctioneer Simon Bower welcome five more people to the Bidding Room with another batch of weird and wonderful lots. The dealers bid against each other on a fairground dodgem, two figurines, a pair of ornate candlesticks, a vintage garden sprayer and a rescued mannequin

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: This week's seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to test their culinary wits. Challenges include cooking a dish to a brief set by one of the country's toughest food critics, Leyla Kazim. John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be passing judgement as usual

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at HWKR Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View

programme.title: Question Time

programme.title: Newscast

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: In the semi-final, the four remaining singers take over Radio 1, facing an interview on Future Artists with Jack Saunders before performing a cover version of a hit song on Live Lounge. Finally, the station's playlist team will scrutinise their original compositions to see if their music has commercial viability for today's airwaves

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The woman who raised thousands of pounds for her best friend's cancer treatment, only to find out the diagnosis was a lie. Plus, Dr Xand and co-host Ashley John-Baptiste reveal whether 10,000 steps really is a magic number when it comes to staying healthy

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who has collapsed in the heat, and 999 call handlers deal with a patient having a heart attack while on the phone

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A university student, an electrician and a bathroom fitter buy properties in Hall Green, Birmingham, Wantage, Oxfordshire and Greenhithe, Kent, which all need extensive renovations

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Christina Trevanion and experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss go antique hunting in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire, before heading to Lichfield in Staffordshire for today's auction. programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Marlene is unable to investigate a racing pigeon theft, as she is allergic to birds. Al and Callum discover that the owner may be better off without his feathered friends due to a rare medical condition that could kill him. Finn tells Siobhan that he's decided to move out of the family home, so she turns her attentions to Port Devine's most eligible bachelor. Niamh catches her father drinking while working

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Retired couple Steven and Sue love their two-bedroom bungalow, but Steven's mobility issues have left Sue taking on more of the workload, and their tired, cluttered shed does not help matters. The team sets out to turn the shed into a practical and welcoming space for Sue to do her volunteer work, and make it easier for Steven to access his mobility scooter

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In the Cotswolds, Nicki Chapman and a couple from Scotland don't need to look too far to find the characterful cottage of their dreams for a £600,000 budget. While in the locality, Nicki drops in on showjumping legend and double Olympic gold medallist Nick Skelton, along with his sons Harry and Dan, who are following in their father's 'hoof' prints

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid against each other on a plate with a famous name on it, a light from an operating theatre, a puzzle box and some Chinese silver - as well as a quirky orange item

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: The last two cooks standing face the ultimate culinary showdown. Revisiting two of the ingredients previously featured in the competition, they're tasked with preparing a formal two-course meal to be served in Crom Castle's grand state dining room. Their efforts are strutinised by judges Danni Barry and Joris Minne and enjoyed by enjoyed by the Earl of Erne John Crichton, the two food producers behind the key ingredients and the five cooks who didn't make it this far. Presented by Eamonn Holmes

Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Joshua McCord and Zita Sattar

programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's the early autumn of 1924 and Rose's father-in-law Lord Sinderby has rented Brancaster Castle in Northumberland and invited the Crawleys to a grouse-shooting party. However, the Sinderbys' butler Stowell (guest star Alun Armstrong, New Tricks) has an axe to grind and a scandalous secret threatens to derail the holiday. Back at Downton, the servants hold the fort and unlikely later-life romances abound, while Bates takes drastic measures to clear Anna's name as she faces an uncertain future behind bars. The seasons change and another Christmas is enjoyed at the Abbey, where a heartbreaking farewell and a joyful reunion take place. Feature-length festive special, starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, James Faulkner, Penny Downie, Joanne Froggatt and Brendan Coyle

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A visiting American academic delivers a controversial speech, with many audience members worried his ideas could be used to target ethnic minorities. So when he is found hanged the next morning and Dr Hobson quickly discounts suicide, Lewis and Hathaway realise they have many suspects - from the local anti-racism activist who was first in voicing her disgust at the professor's beliefs to the women who had bombarded him with threatening e-mails. But then another body turns up and the case takes on a new dimension. David Soul and Patrick Baladi guest star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris

programme.desc: Ade's gloating causes Ken to lash out, Sarah tries to come to terms with what has happened, and Norris enlists Kirk in his plot to cover up Mr Woo's untimely demise

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A magician's assistant drops dead on stage, poisoned by the toxins from a tropical frog. While Barnaby and Jones begin their investigations, tempers flare in the local community between Ernest, a firm believer in a mystical cult, and his former friend Aloysius - whose background in the jungles of South America makes him the prime suspect for the murder. Starring John Nettles, Ronald Pickup and Stuart Wilson

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Plans for the wedding are gathering steam, but Lady Mary's meddling lands Carson in trouble with Mrs Hughes. Cora and Violet clash over plans for the hospital takeover, and Thomas's job search is proving disheartening. Mary comes up with a fresh idea that offers Anna new hope, prompting a trip to London, and Lady Edith faces challenges at the magazine although it's a problem closer to home that reaches breaking point. A day out for the family and servants ends in panic and leaves Robert facing a difficult decision

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly antagonises local ramblers by closing off a public footpath across his land, while Greengrass appoints himself Aidensfield's new chimney-sweep _ but displays his usual reluctance to actually do any work, convinced he can make far more money by conning soon-to-be-married couples into hiring him as a 'lucky' wedding guest. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Rupert Vansittart

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor spends his last day in Portwenn seeing an influx of patients as he prepares to close down the surgery and move to London. As he bids farewell to old friends and sets off to leave the village, he sees Louisa's teaching assistant Tasha fall from the Harbour Day stage and stops to help. But the bigger hold-up comes when pregnant Louisa is involved in a car accident. Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz star

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP struggles to come to terms with his new role as a father, having planned to resume his career as a consultant in London before the arrival of his and Louisa's as-yet unnamed son. To make matters worse, he begins to have serious doubts about the competency of his replacement Dr Di Dibbs when she misdiagnoses a patient as well as herself. Martin is then dealt a devastating personal blow after hearing his aunt Joan has died. Starring Martin Clunes, Joanna Scanlan and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Tony and Carol investigate when the grisly remains of recent murder victims are unearthed during excavation work on the foundations of a hotel. When the building is subsequently burned to the ground, Tony suspects dark forces from the distant past are still very much active - and wonders whether the fact the hotel was built on the grounds of a ruined abbey could hold a clue to the mystery

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Unable to stand the tension any longer, Sarah fires Caroline from Leopard's Den, but she is promptly installed as deputy at Mara. However, disaster strikes as she and the Mara guests are threatened by lions. Meanwhile, Rosie is annoyed by the presence of the students vying for the position of vet assistant, particularly as one of them keeps flirting with Max. Fed up with the upheaval, Du Plessis hatches a plan to get everything back to normal, but it backfires dramatically and leaves a cheetah's life in danger

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The increasing elephant population presents Danny with a problem, but Mara's new owner Elliot Kriel offers a solution. Du Plessis is thrilled when his son Kirk brings news that his girlfriend Neema is pregnant, but his joy is short-lived when the couple announce their future plans - and the soon-to-be grandfather seeks solace in the bottle. A hen party of excitable young women, the first guests of the luxury lodge, proves invaluable when a group of rich, demanding bankers causes trouble. Drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson

programme.desc: Arthur's minicab firm is targeted by saboteurs. programme.title: ITV Racing Live

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: A look back at memorable stagings of the race from Epsom Downs. Featuring brilliant performances from Shergar to Sea The Stars, plus interviews with personalities from the worlds of sport and entertainment

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Bearer bonds go missing from gangster Bobby Altman, and suspect Billy Gilpin appears at Arthur's house wanting to get out of town. Terry drives him to a hotel, but when Altman finds out he believes Arthur is involved and tries to establish the truth. George Baker and Roy Kinnear guest star

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade heads to Russia's remote Amur River, where the mysterious deaths of three men appear to be linked to a freshwater giant - a beast that can exceed 18ft in length and weigh more than a ton. However, he encounters a wall of silence and begins to suspect he has stumbled on to a dark secret that isn't supposed to be uncovered

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Squizzy is fatigued after working around the clock to fill a new 200kg order. Meanwhile, a major storm front closes over Tasmania, with the Bold Contender, the William Norling and the Barralee all at risk

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Cumbrian couple Rob and Ruth, who have bought a 200-year-old former blacking mill and plan to slot in an entirely new, timber-clad structure within its walls, giving the impression that it is peeping out from the original ruins. But the original building is a scheduled monument and Historic England inform them it is too dangerous to repair, giving them no choice but to painstakingly rebuild the ancient mill around their new structure

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A cheesemaker meets a marketer with an endless line of jokes, and a company director and a fan of motorbikes and rockabilly share their love of the 1950s. Two gym enthusiasts seem to hit it off, but disaster strikes later in the night, while two executives with a taste for sharp suits seem like a good fit

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses (2016)
programme.desc: A suburban couple become embroiled in an international espionage plot when they discover that their seemingly perfect new neighbours are actually government spies. Action comedy, starring Zach Galifianakis, Isla Fisher, Jon Ham and Gal Gadot

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Guillermo Galdos follows Brazilian federal police cracking down on illegal mining in protected Indigenous regions and the network of companies dealing in the precious metal. Officially Brazil exports a hundred tons of gold a year. But efforts by police, academics and non-governmental organisations reveal evidence that possibly almost half of Brazil's gold trade comes from an illegal source, raising serious concerns for tech companies using gold in their products

programme.desc: The presenter travels across the two counties in south-west England. His journey begins in North Devon under the shadow of England's highest sea cliff, the 1,000ft-tall Great Hangman, and finishes up on the stunning three-mile golden sands of Woolacombe. Along the way, Michael is joined by Raynor Winn, whose bestselling book The Salt Path is based on her experiences of walking the South West Coast Path with her terminally-ill husband, Moth. She tells of how it changed their lives, and offers tips and advice for Michael's journey ahead, and how he should prepare for the challenges, both physical and emotional

programme.title: Arthur's Hallowed Ground (1986)
programme.desc: A cricket groundsman plans to make the perfect pitch, but soon finds himself fighting a losing battle against his home team, who seem hell-bent on starting a turf war. Comedy drama, starring Jimmy Jewel, David Swift, Vas Blackwood and Michael Elphick

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: The Bedford Incident (1965)
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II (1986)
programme.desc: High-kicking teenager Daniel accompanies his venerable mentor Mr Miyagi when he returns to the Japanese province of Okinawa to visit his dying father. However, an old rival of Miyagi's is waiting for them, while Daniel is drawn into a vicious conflict with their enemy's own karate protege. Martial arts sequel, starring Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita and Yuji Okumoto

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (1982)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew faces a bitter battle to the death with an old enemy. Khan, a genetically engineered superhuman tyrant, has escaped exile on a barren planet and hijacked a starship to take his revenge on Admiral Kirk, while also scheming to turn an experimental planet-creating device into a doomsday weapon. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, Ricardo Montalban and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Deadpool 2 (2018)
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future. With the aid of fellow mutant Domino and five less lucky teammates, they attempt to defeat the villainous Cable. Action comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: They Live (1988)
programme.desc: A drifter arrives in Los Angeles seeking work, only to discover the city's population is being dominated by aliens who control their victims through subliminal advertising. John Carpenter's satirical sci-fi adventure, starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (1957)
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part III (1989)
programme.desc: The teenage martial arts expert becomes obsessed with defending his championship title, but wise mentor Mr Miyagi is not prepared to help him fight for such a shallow goal. Seeking someone else to help guide his career, he falls under the influence of a crooked trainer - who is secretly plotting his downfall with the help of an old adversary. Adventure sequel, starring Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita

programme.title: Footloose (1984)
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker

programme.title: Men in Black: International (2019)
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Gray's fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Wind River (2017)
programme.desc: When veteran hunter Cory Lambert discovers a young women's frozen body in Wyoming Native American reservation, he gains help from an inexperienced FBI agent to investigate the suspicious murder. Taylor Sheridan's crime drama, starring Jeremy Renner and Elizabeth Olsen

programme.title: Trespass Against Us (2016)
programme.desc: An Irish Traveller tries to give his children what he never had - a solid start in life with a decent education. Crime drama, starring Michael Fassbender and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Red Mountain (1951)
programme.desc: A Confederate captain sets out to join forces with notorious guerilla militia Quantrill's Raiders, but stops off en route to rescue a man from being lynched for a murder he himself committed - and complicates matters by falling for his fiancee. Western set during the American Civil War, starring Alan Ladd and Lizabeth Scott

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Dad's Army (1971)
programme.desc: The ragtag soldiers of the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard are given the chance to prove their mettle by apprehending three German aviators who have parachuted into the country in the vanguard of a suspected Nazi invasion. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid (1994)
programme.desc: Wise karate mentor Mr Miyagi meets the orphaned teenage grand-daughter of a soldier who once saved his life. As well as guiding her through the trials of high school and her first romance, he takes her to a Zen monastery to hone her martial arts skills. Adventure sequel, starring Pat Morita, Hilary Swank, Michael Ironside and Constance Towers

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Darkman (1990)
programme.desc: A scientist working on synthetic skin is horribly disfigured and left for dead by a criminal gang. Now unable to feel pain, he continues his research, creating artificial faces that will last for only a short time. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The story of a family divided by agricultural hardship who ended up living on opposite sides of the world, and as the team races to find the heirs to a recently advertised unclaimed estate, a surprise connection is made in Malta

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David Lewis and Giles Beaton kick off the competition at Langland Road in Swansea, where they hope to impress their guests with an ultra-modern approach. Unfortunately, not all the guests can figure out what the hi-tech offerings are. To make matters worse, traditionalists Gordon and Sandra McCallum are more concerned by cobwebs and dust

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ruth and Margaret Dugdall welcome their rivals to Castle Lodge Hotel in Felixstowe, Suffolk. Ed Prophet plays a series of tricks on Gordon McCallum in the hope of making him smile, but previous hosts David Lewis and Giles Beaton are unimpressed when the prankster takes on the role of waiter

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gordon and Sandra McCallum host at Bryn Woodlands House in Colwyn Bay, Conwy, where they take the group harness racing. Ed Prophet worries about getting manure on his face, and later receives a shock. Margaret and Ruth Dugdall think the B&B's decor is poor, and Giles Beaton has a problem with a bottle of ketchup

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Edward Prophet and fiancee Rachel Pickup play host at the Tollemache Arms in Cheshire as the week's competition enters the final round. The couple pull out all the stops to charm their guests, but their efforts are undermined by a shambolic breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the contestants prepare to discover which of their establishments has won the competition, the owners of Langland Road are shocked by a peculiar payment, and begin to suspect something is amiss. The Castle Lodge hoteliers are dismayed when criticism is directed towards their new wallpaper, and the proprietors of Bryn Woodland House struggle to face up to their shortcomings

programme.title: Love It or List It Australia
programme.desc: A couple must decide whether to leave or change their timber cottage in Pascoe Vale, Melbourne, which was the perfect size when they had two children - but not so much with four

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Larne in Northern Ireland with Catherine and Nigel Finch, who have been married for seven years, but lately have hit a spot of turbulence due to their dated, 1970s-style bungalow. Nigel quickly fell for their rural location's incredible views, but Catherine has never loved the place and misses having neighbours, so Phil searches for a home that pleases them both, offering room for Nigel's beloved chickens, while giving Catherine more people around her

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge fixes up his temperamental van at his chateau. Erin and JB start work on their honeymoon suite and solarium/sun room; with a little help from their friends. Alison and Paul make an exciting discovery with an underground chamber, which they transform into a bedroom complete with arrow hole window

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt visits the heart of Texas to help out a retired couple who run a pecan farm. He then travels north and reaches Fort Worth just in time for the world's oldest rodeo and stock show where farmers from 42 states bring their cows, goats, horses and other livestock with hopes of winning a big prize. Matt then heads back into the countryside as he meets one of the state's newest farmers, along with the donkeys and cattle that are helping him become a social media star

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration

With a budget of £300,000, will any of the five properties on offer impress them enough to make an offer?

programme.desc: Guest-house owners in Spain hope their music event will not attract the local police. In France, a motorhome rental business deals with damaged vehicles and the owners of a holiday village in Portugal deal with an unfortunate leak

programme.desc: The team is near Preston, where Simon O'Brien restores a spotlight he believes may be from a German U-boat while Henry Cole gets creative with an aircraft jump seat

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Megan Edgcumbe and Dick Stanley host the latest round of the competition at Manor Lodge in Cornwall. Things get off to a good start when the guests find their rooms clean, but later the hostess reveals her upper-class background and a Cumberland sausage causes a stir at breakfast

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien restores an enamel roll-top bath and builds a den out of old doors. Henry Cole makes a wall mounted safe from a jerry can and lovingly restores a cheese-making trough

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep below the surface

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost. At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: The Drug Squad hunts for an illegal fuel stash hidden deep in the Rock of Gibraltar, and Customs officers find valuable intelligence in an abandoned boat

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels floor it in a dramatic high-speed pursuit after a suspected drug dealer. Plus, a lucky break, as a car that previously gave them the slip drives right past the cops

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: This comedy pair have only recently got to know each other and couldn't be more different - Darren is a former bouncer and self-confessed city boy with an obsession for social media, and Ria is full of adventurous spirit with a PhD and autism. She's persuaded him to go rogue and hit South Africa, and it's 1.2 million square kilometres of wilderness just waiting to be explored. They begin their 800km journey getting to know each other better in Cape Town before heading inland and off-road, tackling ancient valleys, jagged mountains and vast plains seeking out adventure on their way to the tip of the continent. This whirlwind trip into nature and the unknown helps them both face things in life they find a challenge

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Recalling the Bolton steeplejack's love of 19th-century life, which he said he wished he had lived through. The programme also looks at his admiration for great engineering and architecture, heading to locations such as Tower Bridge and Eastnor Castle

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the Bolton steeplejack's love of restoring engines and chimneys, highlighting one of his greatest triumphs - the steam traction engine he painstakingly repaired over 27 years. His great appreciation for volunteers who dedicated their lives to preserving the past is also explored

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reads the riot act in Preston, and discovers four mill workers were shot dead at a protest in 1842. In Darwen, he traces developments in interior design from wallpaper to paint, before exploring the Victorian industrial landscape of Salford in the paintings on LS Lowry. He finishes his leg of the journey on Kersal Moor, where he discovers the poetry of Edwin Waugh and twists his tongue around the Lancashire dialect

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from St Helens to Knutsford, finding out about modern glass-making and how techniques invented in the Victorian era to construct buildings such as the Crystal Palace have evolved and are powering a new architectural revolution

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.desc: Derek encourages the team to buy a Francis Barnett Plover at auction. Plus, the wheels come off the restoration of an MG Metro

programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a croissant factory in France that produces 336,000 pastries a day, and discovers how an 83-year-old strain of yeast is used to create the perfect flavour.
